scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection of James Fenimore Cooper papers includes letters and invitations.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to Carey, Lea, and Blanchard 13 April 1838

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Carey, Lea, Blanchard, regarding Homeward Boundand Home as Found.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to Mrs. Peter A. Jay 15-20 September 1826
Printed invitation to Cooper from MMe la Mise de Dolomieu 6 February 1831
Letter from [Cooper?] to Armand Carrel [7?] March 1832

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Armand Carrel, for Le National (Paris), [missing 3/27/68].

did.unittitle: Letter (invitation) from...to Cooper 16 February 1835
Letter from Cooper to M. Dubois (invitation) 3 March 1835
Letter from ... to Cooper 25 September 1835
Letter from Cooper to Lewis Gaylord Clark 12 July 1845

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Lewis Gaylord Clark, regarding Bunker Hill in Lionel Lincoln. This is found in James Franklin Beard's Letters and Journals of James Fenimore Cooper, Volume V, 46.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to Richard H. Dana, Sr. 30 October 1845
did.physdesc: ALS, 2 pages. Blue Slipcase in Barrett Room mislabeled "Oct 20, 1845."

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Richard H. Dana, Sr., lecturing to the Mercantile Library Association of Boston, regarding naval history. This is found in James Franklin Beard's Letters and Journals of James Fenimore Cooper, Volume V, 92.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to George Robertson, Jr. 9 November 1846

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Geroge Robertson, Jr., declining to lecture.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to Horace Greenough 6 May 1847

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Horace Greenough, introduction for W. W. Campbell. (Samuel F.B. Morse?), family affairs.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to George P. Putnam 10 December 1847

scopecontent.p: Cooper to George P. Putnam, regarding medal Cooper struck by Commodore Elliott after the Battle of Lake Erie controversy was settled. Mentions Mr. Adams and Hist. Soc. of R.I. [ca. 1848?] P.S. regarding Free Soil agitation, with Cooper autograph pasted on bottom.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to John Fagan 19 October 1849

scopecontent.p: Cooper to John Fagan, regarding financial and legal affairs.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to John Fagan 7 March 1849

scopecontent.p: Cooper to John Fagan, regarding new edition of The Spy. "The work must equal Irving's Sketch Book..." Important. Also Sea Lions. This is found in James Franklin Beard's Letters and Journals of James Fenimore Cooper, Volume VI, 15.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to John Fagan 21 November 1849

scopecontent.p: Cooper to John Fagan, mentions The Ways of the Hour, Red Rover, Pioneers, Mohicans, Prairie.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to William Starbuck Mayo February 1850
did.physdesc: ALS, typescript; original is pasted in book.

scopecontent.p: Cooper to William Starbuck Mayo, regarding friends: Gen. Scott, Read, Kearny, Shubrick.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to George P. Putnam [19?] June 1850

scopecontent.p: Cooper to George P. Putnam, regarding Rural Hours. This is found in James Franklin Beard's Letters and Journals of James Fenimore Cooper, Volume VI, 195.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to James Hackett 23 October 1850

scopecontent.p: Cooper to James Hackett. This is found in James Franklin Beard's Letters and Journals of James Fenimore Cooper, Volume VI, 229.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to Henry F.C. Atkins 13 December 1850

p.bibref: This is found in James Franklin Beard's Letters and Journals of James Fenimore Cooper, Volume VI, 247.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to Mrs. [H] Fish 1 August n.y.

scopecontent.p: Cooper to Mrs. [H] Fish, regarding personal and family news.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to M. De Voraign ALS, in French, 1 page
Letter from Charles Mathews to Cooper n.d.

scopecontent.p: Charles Mathews, actor, to Cooper, invitation. Signed "Mat."

did.unittitle: Letter to press on taxation n.d.
did.physdesc: AMs, 3 pages folio, with typescript and newspaper clipping

scopecontent.p: Letter to press on taxation, Lafayette's opinions, etc. Newspaper clipping on Cooper's libel suit.

did.unittitle: Letter from Cooper to M. Dubois n.d.
